text: Modoc is an unincorporated community in Emanuel County, in the U.S. state of Georgia. ==History== A post office called Modoc was established in 1888, and remained in operation until 1929. The community was named after the Modoc Indians. The Georgia General Assembly incorporated Modoc as a town in 1912. The town's municipal charter was repealed in 1995. ==References== Category:Former municipalities in Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Unincorporated communities in Emanuel County, Georgia Category:Populated places disestablished in 1995
title: Modoc, Georgia
